channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: US admiral leading US troops in Latin America to step down
item.description: The admiral in charge of US military forces in Latin America will retire two years early on Friday, amid rising tensions with Venezuela that include Wednesday's seizure of an oil tanker and more than 20 deadly strikes on suspected drug-smuggling boats. Three US officials and two people familiar wi

item.title: A 6.9 magnitude earthquake causes small tsunami waves off northeastern Japan
item.description: A 6.9 magnitude earthquake shook northeastern Japan and caused small tsunami waves but no apparent damage Friday, days after a stronger quake in the same region. Friday’s quake occurred off the east coast of Aomori prefecture, in the north of Honshu, the main Japanese island, at a depth of 2

item.title: Thailand's snap poll set to boost odds for PM Anutin, but risks loom
item.description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul looks set to tap burgeoning nationalism over a border conflict with Cambodia to boost his appeal in a general election stemming from his dissolution of parliament after less than 100 days in power. The political manoeuvering came after fierce bor

item.title: Belgium deputy PM: Russian frozen assets to be used for Ukraine loan
item.description: Russian frozen assets will have to be used for Ukraine at some point, Belgium’s deputy prime minister Vincent Van Peteghem said on Thursday, added however Belgium “would not take any reckless compromises” before it agreed to any deal over this. “At some point, these frozen

item.title: US preparing to seize more tankers off Venezuela's coast
Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing appears in court, judge mulls media access
Nobel Peace Prize winner Machado vows to bring award back to Venezuela
Trump says to make phone call to stop Thai-Cambodia fighting
Trump unveils $12b aid package for farmers hit by trade war

7.0-magnitude earthquake hits Alaska
US becomes major source of gun violence in Caribbean: report

In JD Vance case, US Supreme Court may again chip away campaign finance limits
US lawmakers want war powers vote after Trump pledges Venezuela attack 'soon'
ADB approves 100m USD loan to boost financial access for women entrepreneurs in India
item.description: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) on Friday said it has signed a 100-million-U.S.-dollar loan agreement with Five-Star Business Finance Limited (FBFL) to expand access to micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) business loans for women borrowers from lower-income groups in India. T

item.title: Thai PM moves to dissolve parliament
item.description: Thailand's Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul announced on Thursday that he is "returning power to the people," moving to dissolve parliament and clear the way for elections earlier than previously anticipated. Government spokesperson Siripong Angkasakulkiat told Reuters the move followed a disagr

item.title: Desperate Gazans pull iron bars from rubble to construct tents and scratch out a living
item.description: As winter bites in Gaza, displaced Palestinians set out every day to homes destroyed by Israel. There they rip out iron rods from the walls and use them to prop up their flimsy tents or sell to scratch out a living in an enclave that will take years to recover from war. The rods have become a ho

item.title: Pakistan's ex-spy chief jailed for 14 years in rare military rebuke
item.description: A military court in Pakistan jailed former spy chief Faiz Hamid for 14 years on four charges including interference in politics, the army said on Thursday, in a rare conviction of a once-powerful general in the South Asian nation. Hamid, in custody and under trial since August last year, was the c

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia keep fighting across contested border
item.description: Fighting between Thailand and Cambodia entered its fourth day on Thursday as both sides waited for a promised telephone call from US President Donald Trump, who says he believes he can again end the conflict between the two Southeast Asian nations. On Wednesday, clashes at more than a dozen locati

item.title: Cambodia vows fierce fight against Thailand in their escalating border conflict
item.description: Cambodia’s Senate President Hun Sen vowed a fierce fight against Thailand as a second day of widespread renewed combat between the nations Tuesday drove tens of thousands of people to flee border areas. The fighting following a skirmish Sunday that injured two Thai soldiers and derailed a ce

item.title: Australia begins enforcing world-first teen social media ban
item.description: Australia on Wednesday became the first country to ban social media for children under 16, blocking access in a move welcomed by many parents and child advocates but criticised by major technology companies and free-speech advocates. Starting at midnight (1300 GMT on Tuesday), 10 of the largest pl

item.title: Orangutans at risk as Indonesia floods devastate habitat
item.description: Before the deadly landslides and floods hit Indonesia about two weeks ago, Amran Siagian, 39, frequently met Tapanuli orangutans on a hill in the region of Sipirok, North Sumatra province. Siagian, who has been working as a ranger to protect the endangered animal at the Orangutan Information Cente

item.title: Australia social media ban set to take effect, sparking a global crackdown
item.description: Australia is set to become the first country to implement a minimum age for social media use on Wednesday, with platforms like Instagram, TikTok and YouTube forced to block more than a million accounts, marking the beginning of an expected global wave of regulation. From midnight (1300 GMT), 10 of

item.title: Thailand-Cambodia fighting spreads along contested border
item.description: Thailand said it was taking action to expel Cambodian forces from its territory on Tuesday, as renewed fighting between the two Southeast Asian neighbours spread along the disputed border. Each side has blamed the other for the clashes, which have derailed a fragile ceasefire brokered by US Presid

item.title: Six Pakistani soldiers killed in militant attack, police and security sources say
item.description: Six Pakistani soldiers were killed in a militant attack on a security post in the country's northwest, three police and security sources told Reuters on Tuesday. The attack took place between Monday night and Tuesday morning in the former tribal district of Kurram, which is close to the border wit

item.title: Magnitude 7.5 quake in Japan injures 23
item.description: A powerful 7.5 magnitude earthquake struck off northern Japan late Monday, injuring 23 people and triggering a tsunami in Pacific coast communities, officials said. Authorities warned of possible aftershocks and an increased risk of a megaquake. The Japanese government was still assessing damages
